column1: Paraíso (Spanish pronunciation: [paɾaˈiso]) is a district of the Paraíso canton
column2: in the Cartago province of Costa Rica.

column1: Paraíso has an area of 27 km² and an elevation of 1
column2: 325 metres. It is located 8 km southeast of Cartago.

column1: The district is covered by the following road routes:
Lankester Botanical Garden (named after British biologist Charles Lankester)
Farmer's Market in the center of town
Finca la Flor de Paraiso (a non-profit organic farm)
